title: Ubuntu Desktop
description: Ubuntu Desktop is a user-friendly Linux distribution, widely used for desktops and laptops. It provides a modern interface and extensive software support.

title: Ubuntu Server
description: Ubuntu Server is a Linux distribution optimized for servers. It is widely used in cloud environments and data centers due to its stability and scalability.

title: Debian
description: Debian is a stable and versatile Linux distribution known for its reliability and large software repository. It forms the basis of many other distributions, including Ubuntu.

title: AlmaLinux
description: AlmaLinux is a free, open-source Linux distribution designed as a community-driven replacement for CentOS, providing enterprise-grade stability.

title: CentOS Stream
description: CentOS Stream is a Linux distribution that provides a rolling preview of the next version of Red Hat Enterprise Linux, positioned between Fedora and RHEL.

title: Rocky Linux Stream
description: Rocky Linux is a community-driven enterprise Linux distribution, designed to be a downstream, binary-compatible alternative to RHEL after CentOS changed direction.

title: Windows Server
description: Windows Server is a Microsoft operating system designed for enterprise use, offering features for server management, virtualization, and networking.

title: Fedora
description: Fedora is a cutting-edge Linux distribution sponsored by Red Hat, known for integrating the latest technologies and innovations in the Linux ecosystem.

title: OpenSUSE
description: openSUSE is a community-driven Linux distribution known for its stability and strong administrative tools such as YaST. It is suitable for both servers and desktops.

title: Arch Linux
description: Arch Linux is a lightweight and flexible Linux distribution that follows a rolling release model, targeting advanced users who want full control of their system.

title: Windows Desktop
description: Windows Desktop refers to Microsoftâ€™s desktop operating systems, including Windows 10 and Windows 11, widely used for personal and professional computing.

title: Proxmox Backup Server
description: Proxmox Backup Server is an enterprise backup solution for virtual machines, containers, and physical hosts, offering deduplication and efficient data management.

title: SystemRescue
description: SystemRescue is a Linux-based rescue system designed for repairing unbootable computers and performing administrative tasks.

title: Gparted
description: GParted is a free partition editor for managing disk partitions, allowing resizing, copying, and moving partitions without data loss.

title: Windows VirtIO Drivers
description: Windows VirtIO Drivers are optimized drivers for running Windows virtual machines on KVM-based hypervisors, improving performance and compatibility.

title: TrueNAS SCALE Fangtooth
description: TrueNAS SCALE Fangtooth is a version of the TrueNAS SCALE NAS operating system, offering advanced storage, virtualization, and containerization features.

title: TrueNAS SCALE ElectricEel
description: TrueNAS SCALE ElectricEel is another release of the TrueNAS SCALE NAS operating system, focused on modern storage and cloud integration.
